entry.title: Google, Stanford say big data is key to deep learning for drug discovery
entry.quote: A team of researchers from Stanford University and Google have released a paper highlighting a deep learning approach they say shows promise in the field of drug discovery. What they found, essentially, is that that more data covering more biological processes seems like a good recipe for uncovering new drugs.

entry.title: In praise of the humble fruit fly, leading the way on cancer research
entry.quote: We can breed flies with genetic alterations mimicking those in specific cancers, and then look for an organ in the fly (such as the wing – it does not have to be the “original” human organ) where these alterations lead to cancerous growth, and study how this happens.

entry.title: Email overload: Building my own email app to reach Inbox Zero.
entry.quote: My inbox seemed like a library havocked by a tornado, with torn pages scattered helter-skelter across the room. I spent as much time searching for messages in that mess as reading them. Organizing them seemed like a futile fight against entropy, and by the time I was done, I barely felt like responding to them—after all, responding would just yield more email. My email felt broken. If only there were a way to fix it.

entry.title: The Paradox of Empathy
entry.quote: Stop making lists of everything we don’t like, as I did with that product manager, and instead move up the intellectual stack and start framing our concerns as flowing, bridging, or understanding tasks
